subclassFeature.name: Way of the Kensei
entries: Monks of the Way of the Kensei train relentlessly with implements of war, to the point where their equipment becomes an extension of the body. Founded on a mastery of sword fighting, the tradition has expanded to include many different weapons and armor.

A kensei sees a weapon in much the same way a calligrapher or painter regards a pen or brush. Whatever the weapon, the kensei views it as a tool used to express the beauty and precision of the martial arts. That such mastery makes a kensei a peerless warrior is but a side effect of intense devotion, practice, and study.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior-Monk Training
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, your special martial arts training leads you to master the intricate dance of martial arts with certain weapons and armor. This path also includes instruction in the deft strokes of calligraphy or painting. You gain the following benefits.

subclassFeature.name: Kensei Weapons
entries: Choose two types of weapons to be your kensei weapons: one melee weapon and one ranged weapon. Each of these weapons can be any simple or martial weapon that lacks the loading and special properties. You gain proficiency with these weapons if you don't already have it. Weapons of the chosen types are monk weapons for you. Many of this tradition's features work only with your kensei weapons.When you reach 6th, 11th, and 17th level in this class, you can choose another type of weapon — either melee or ranged — to be a kensei weapon for you, following the criteria above.

Using a {@filter heavy|items|type=weapon|property=heavy} melee weapon as a kensei weapon requires intense focus and control; the first time that you make an attack using such a weapon during a turn, you must spend 1 ki point, or you become unable to use your Martial Arts feature, as well as unable to spend any Ki, until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Kensei Armor
entries: You retain the benefits of your Unarmored Defense and Martial Arts features even while wearing light armor or medium armor which doesn't impose disadvantage on your Stealth checks. You can use the armor's AC if your Unarmored Defense feature would leave you with lower AC.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Brush
entries: You gain proficiency with your choice of {@item calligrapher's supplies|PHB} or {@item painter's supplies|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Flowing Arts
entries: Training with kensei weapons makes it possible for you to express your martial arts in the following ways, suited to the warrior-monk's unique way of fighting.

subclassFeature.name: Agile Parry
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action and attack at least once with a melee weapon that is also your kensei weapon or an unarmed strike, you can use the weapon to defend yourself. Until the start of your next turn, you can use your reaction when you are attacked to gain a +1 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn, while the weapon is in your hand and you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

foundryData.activation.condition: you are attacked, and you attacked with your kensei weapon or unarmed strike previously

subclassFeature.name: Kensei's Shot
entries: You can use a bonus action on your turn to make your ranged attacks with a kensei weapon more deadly. When you do so, any target you hit with a ranged attack using a kensei weapon takes an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the weapon's type. You retain this benefit until the end of the current turn. At 11th level in this class, the extra damage increases to {@damage 1d6}.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Blade
entries: At 6th level, you extend your ki into your kensei weapons, granting you the following benefits.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Kensei Weapons
entries: Your attacks with your kensei weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Deft Strike
entries: When you hit a target with a kensei weapon, you can spend 1 ki point to cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target equal to your Martial Arts die. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

subclassFeature.name: Ki Honing
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to augment your weapons further with your ki. As a bonus action, you can expend up to 3 ki points to grant one kensei weapon you touch a bonus to attack and damage rolls when you attack with it. The bonus equals the number of ki points you spent. If the weapon is a magical weapon that already has such a bonus, its bonus instead becomes the amount of ki points you spent. This bonus lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Unerring Accuracy
entries: At 17th level, your mastery of weapons grants you extraordinary accuracy. If you miss with an attack roll using a monk weapon on your turn, you can reroll it. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.
